New Records: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander scored a career-high 39 points on 71.4% shooting for the Oklahoma City Thunder in their win against the New York Knicks, passing Gary Payton for the second most games with 30+ points in franchise history behind Kevin Durant's 14
Key Match Events: The Oklahoma City Thunder defeated the New York Knicks 126-101, with a dominant 70-point performance from Shai Gilgeous-Alexander and Isaiah Joe, and a strong defensive effort leading to a 30-9 run early in the game
Pre-Game Insights: The Thunder were looking to bounce back from a franchise-record 15-game win streak being snapped, and they wasted no time in their matchup against the Knicks
Post-Match Reflections: The Thunder improved to 5-1 following a loss this season and strengthened their position in the standings with the win
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was highlighted by SGA's historic performance, a warm reception for Isaiah Hartenstein upon his return to Madison Square Garden, and the Thunder's strong defensive performance
Others: The article also covered other games and events, but the primary focus was on the Oklahoma City Thunder's performance against the New York Knicks
